questions.question_text: Identify two reasons for defining machines and assigning servers to them in WebLogic Server. (Choose two.)

choices.C: To reference an instance of WebLogic Server, you must know its machine and port.
choices.B: A machine definition is required to configure the Node Manager.
choices.D: A machine is a required organizational unit. A domain contains machines and machines contain servers.
choices.A: A machine can be the proxy to a cluster.
choices.E: WebLogic Server uses server machine assignments to help it choose servers in a cluster on which to replicate session state.
choices.F: A machine's Cluster Weight attribute may be used by load balancers to help them determine how often to send requests to servers assigned to that machine.

choices.D: Add a server to the cluster.
choices.E: Add a server to the machine.
choices.F: Add the cluster to the machine.

questions.question_text:
To support a growing application workload, you need to scale out an existing (nondynamic) cluster. You power up the new hardware and install WebLogic server.
Which two changes are mandatory for you to make to your domain configuration? (Choose two.)

choices.A: To use the Reconfiguration Wizard, your current WebLogic Server version must be 9.0 or higher.
choices.C: After running the wizard to update your domain, you must reapply your start script customizations.
choices.B: The Domain Upgrade Wizard is no longer available in 12.1.2.
choices.D: You need to update the domain's administration server files.

questions.question_text: Select the two true statements about upgrading WebLogic Server to version 12c (12.1.12). (Choose two.)

choices.B: This is true (with an exception) because the domain files can be re-created with the pack and unpack utilities. The exception is if your security realm uses the embedded LDAP system. Which is not included in the JAR file created by the pack utility.
choices.C: This is true (with an exception) because the domain files can be re-created with the pack and unpack utilities. The exception is for applications that are deployed to the managed server. Those files are not included in the JAR file created by the pack utility. If you back those up manually, then pack and unpack can be used.
choices.A: This is true because the domain files can be re-created with the pack and unpack utilities.
choices.D: This is not true. You need to back up the domain files on a machine on which only managed servers run by using operating system commands (such as tar or zip).

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Penjelasan:

Utilitas pack dan unpack di WebLogic Server digunakan untuk membuat template domain dan mengembalikannya di lingkungan lain. File domain (seperti konfigurasi, skrip, dll.) dapat direkonstruksi dengan alat ini.

Namun, data LDAP tertanam (embedded LDAP) yang digunakan untuk menyimpan informasi keamanan (seperti pengguna, grup, kebijakan) tidak disertakan dalam file JAR hasil pack. Jika domain menggunakan LDAP tertanam, data ini harus dicadangkan secara terpisah.

Opsi lain seperti aplikasi yang di-deploy (opsi C) tidak relevan karena file aplikasi biasanya disimpan di luar direktori domain dan tidak tergantung pada pack/unpack. Opsi D salah karena pack/unpack sudah cukup untuk file domain.

Selected Answer: B
I think B, because the security data is stored in the LDAP server and is not included in the template.
https://docs.oracle.com/middleware/1213/wls/WLDPU/commands.htm#WLDPU172

Selected Answer: A
O correto Ã© a A

I think Answer is A

Source: A Comprehensive Certification Guide by Gustavo Garnica

There are important differences between backing up managed servers and backing
up the administration server. As explained in previous chapters, managed servers
maintain copies of certain information that are centrally kept in the administration
server, such as the main domain configuration repository3 and the contents of the
embedded LDAP.

Upon starting, managed servers will contact the administration server
to obtain a fresh copy of those artifacts. Therefore, it is sufficient to back up managed
servers by exporting their configuration using the pack command with the managed
option

questions.question_text:
An administrator in your organization says you do not need to back up the domain files on a machine which only managed servers run.
Select the best explanation for this statement.

discussion.content:
I think, maybe is correct E: Following this path of choices in order to enable "two phases commit" :
 Domain Structure > Environment > Services > JTA > Enable Two Phase Commit 
----------Indicates that the two-phase commit protocol is used to coordinate transactions across two or more resource managers.
Totally agree, there is no "two phases commit"

choices.D: Configure your data sources with the available XA-compliant driver for your DBMS.
choices.C: Split the transaction into multiple local transactions.
choices.E: Enable Two-phase commit in each data source.
choices.B: WebLogic Server supports distributed transactions by default, so on specific settings are required.
choices.A: Enable use xa Data source interface in the transaction properties of each data source.

questions.question_text:
You need to configure WebLogic Server to satisfy the needs of your new application that will update more than one data set on several databases in the same transaction.
Which setting should be considered?
